snippet: Attention is turning toward regions where legal protections for gays are practically nonexistent and where religious and cultural barriers are strong.
abstract: Supreme Court decision not to take up same-sex marriage cases, seemingly moving country toward marriage rights nationwide for gay couples, has gay advocates looking to push for equality and acceptance in hostile territory, especially the Deep South; leaders are turning their attention to 'low equality states' where religion is woven deeply into fabric of life and gay people who come out often split from their families and churches.
lead_paragraph: Attention is turning toward regions where legal protections for gays are practically nonexistent and where religious and cultural barriers are strong.

headline.main: Dealt a Victory in Court, Advocates for Gay Rights Focus on a New Frontier
headline.print_headline: Dealt a Victory in Court, Advocates for Gay Rights Focus on a New Frontier

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
